meta.title: Update from Superintendent Montange 4/20/2020 - Plainwell Community Schools

meta.content: Superintendent Montange released this update this morning.

meta.name: description
meta.content: Superintendent Montange released this update this morning.

link.title: Performing Arts Center - News

div.label: Translate Page

a.title: ESL Services (English as a Second Language)

li.a: ESL Services (English as a Second Language)

a.title: ESL Services (English as a Second Language)

li.a: ESL Services (English as a Second Language)

span.p: New packets should be arriving to your house any day now, they were in the mail as of Wednesday last week. If you do not receive your packet by the Tuesday mail delivery this week please contact your building principal. All materials are also available on the district website by grade level. An updated weekly schedule is also available online and via social media, this is a modified version of the original weekly schedule that we sent out at the start of the school shut down. Please do your best to establish a daily/weekly routine for your child that is a mix of assigned school work, learning activities, household activities and chores, and family interactions.

Our next round of packets will be scheduled for May, and if the stay at home order continues as planned, we will allow families to come to the school to pick up packets and student belongings that were left in a locker or desk. We will establish a date once the Governor makes a final announcement. As a district we will reschedule activities as and when we are allowed to do so, this includes graduation and related activities. Timing on these events will be determined by what the State of Michigan will allow for large group gatherings. When we know the dates for these activities we will provide them to you so that everyone has an opportunity to plan accordingly.
- First set of NEW learning packets mailed out to families - please let us know if you are at a different address than what is listed with the school in Infinite Campus.
- New learning and courses continue at the High School and Middle School level.
- Some materials and packets will be available for pick-up but most will be delivered.
- Additional learning packets will be sent to families OR picked up in May.
- Student and Staff Expectations are listed below by level.
High School - 2 hours (not to exceed 150 minutes) per day of work on courses (different subjects every day).
Middle School - 1 hour per day (not to exceed 120 minutes) of work on courses (different subject every day).
Elementary - 1 hour per day (not to exceed 90 minutes) of work on packets or online activities.

li.p: Summer programs and athletics are likely cancelled until July unless we get permission to do otherwise.
We will hold graduation ceremonies when we are allowed to do so.
Students will need their lockers cleaned out - this is To Be Determined.
Student schedule and class list processes will continue but will be slower than normal.
Need help or resources? Please ask your teacher or building principal.
Work Hard & Be Nice - GO TROJANS!!
